careTargets.gradient: Vertical gradient preferred - warmer at top (76-78°F), cooler at bottom (72-74°F). Ambient room temperature often sufficient.

notes: One of the easiest reptiles for beginners - very hardy
Nocturnal and crepuscular, most active at night
Can drop their tail when stressed (will not regenerate)
Feed commercial crested gecko diet (CGD) as staple, insects as supplement
Excellent jumpers - secure lid is essential
Can live 15-20 years with proper care

warnings.message: Temperature should NEVER exceed 82°F - overheating is fatal. Do not use basking bulbs unless room is very cold.
Cork bark or bamboo is safer than rough branches - prevents toe injury from shed skin buildup
Beginners: Paper towel substrate is fine for first 6 months while you learn to maintain humidity - bioactive can be added later
Mist in evening (not morning) to simulate natural rainfall pattern and provide drinking water on leaves
While UVB is not required, recent studies show it can improve calcium metabolism and activity levels - consider low-level UVB (2.0 or 5.0)
